tool_description: Query armed conflict events worldwide and visualize them using spatial aggregations.
name: geoconflicts
title: geoconflicts

api_list.name: cluster
api_list.description: Creates spatial clusters using the armed conflict events and returns the features as cluster polygons. You must define a specific date intersecting the valid date extent. The date extent endpoint returns the current date extent. The format can be GeoJSON or Esri JSON.

api_list.name: aggregate
api_list.description: Aggregates the armed conflict events using a spatial grid and returns the features as hexagonal bins. You must define a specific date intersecting the valid date extent. The date extent endpoint returns the current date extent. The format can be GeoJSON or Esri JSON.

api_list.name: dateExtent
api_list.description: Returns the valid date extent of the armed conflict events as a JSON result.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://geoconflicts.p.rapidapi.com/dateExtent"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "geoconflicts.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: query
api_list.description: Queries the armed conflict events and returns the events as features. You must define a specific date intersecting the valid date extent. The date extent endpoint returns the current date extent. The format can be GeoJSON or Esri JSON.

api_list.name: extent
api_list.description: Returns the spatial extent of the armed conflict events as a JSON result.
api_list.code:

url = "https://geoconflicts.p.rapidapi.com/extent"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "geoconflicts.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: count
api_list.description: Returns the number of armed conflict events as a JSON result.
